column5: We are living through a time of immense digital transformation. In order to benefit society, science and businesses, we need to develop the right tools to extract the full value from the ever-increasing growth of digital data. This interdisciplinary two-year master’s programme will provide you with understanding of the state-of-the-art methods and algorithms of data science through hands-on experience with the latest tools and systems in the industry. After graduation, you will be qualified to work in a range of positions in data-centred projects as well as pursue PhD studies in data science.DegreeMaster's Degree (120 credits).Master's degree with a major in Computer Science (120 credits).
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
